{"step_by_step_thinking": "Piperacillin is a ureidopenicillin and is active against pseudomonas aeruginosa as stated in documents [27] and [20]. It is given parenterally as stated in document [0]. However, piperacillin itself does not inhibit beta-lactamase. It is often combined with tazobactam, a beta-lactamase inhibitor, to enhance its effectiveness as stated in document [18].", "answer_choice": "B"}
